PAD_MyrkulSymbol.synopsis: Players enter the room where the symbol of Myrkul lies on the floor. Hard religion DC before the PAD plays.

PAD_MakeshiftVessel.synopsis: Players find a vessel with a half-formed humanoid shape gestating inside and reacts accordingly. The being is just inert flesh and cannot speak.

PAD_Mural_002.synopsis: Player interacts with the third mural of the Mausoleum puzzle and get the final piece of the story. This mural depicts Ketheric Thorm, along with a Sharran army, standing before the corrupted version of Moonrise Towers. Player response varies, depending on if they've seen Ketheric or not. (note: do NOT refer to Moonrise towers by name in these responses, as awareness is not guaranteed)

PAD_KethericsMap.synopsis: Players find the map Ketheric had inside the mausoleum. It shows  the entrance to the Shar Temple (behind Isobel's tomb) and has notes on an attack.
PAD_KethericsMap.how_to_trigger: Interact with the map in the Ketheric mausoleum.

PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.synopsis: PAD for characters reacting to finding Isobels plaque in the Ketheric Mausoleum. Has 3 reaction states:- Already know Ketheric is Isobel's Father- Don't know aboutfamily relationship but have met Isobel- Don't know about family relationship and haven't met Isobel
PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque.how_to_trigger: Click on Isobels PLaque in the Ketheric mausoleum

PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro.synopsis: Party reacts to a magic-mouth skull that projects Balthazar's voice, warning them to leave.

AD_IsobelsPlaque.synopsis: Narrator/player to reading the plaque on Isobel's tomb . If they already know Isobel is Ketheric's daughter, the narrator reaction is different. The Elvish translates to 'Light slays darkness'.Note: the unusual structure of this is because the Origin PAD template is a greeting node and can't be connected to normally.
AD_IsobelsPlaque.how_to_trigger: Interact with the plaque on Isobel's tomb in the mausoleum.

PAD_TempleSuspicion.synopsis: Shadowheart comments on her suspicions that there is probably to the crypt than just a mausoleum. Hinting at the existence of the temple.
PAD_TempleSuspicion.how_to_trigger: 0. Know Shadowheart is a Sharran1. Enter the back of the Thorm Mausoleum

CINE_DescendingIntoTemple.synopsis: Cinematic of players descending into the temple after jumping for the first time on the disc towards the temple.
CINE_DescendingIntoTemple.how_to_trigger: Players interacts with the teleportation stone on Sharran disc that is hidden behind a wall in the back of the Thorm family mausoleum.goto -279; -31; -815NOTE: on subsequent uses of the elevator, a fade to black will be done via script.

PAD_FoundDisc.synopsis: Players find the disc at the mausoleum that leads to the Shar temple.
PAD_FoundDisc.how_to_trigger: goto -280; -29; -845 and teleport behind the wall where the secret doors are or solve the puzzle.

PAD_Mural_000.synopsis: Player interacts with the first mural of the Mausoleum puzzle and get the first piece of the story. This mural depicts Moonrise Towers in its heyday, before it turned to darkness. The player's comment varies, depending on whether they've been to MRT or not.

PAD_OpenTomb.synopsis: Players find the open tomb where Isobel was inside the mausoleum. The PAD should not identify Isobel as the former occupant.

PAD_NecromancersRoom.synopsis: Players enter for the first time inside the necromancer's room at the mausoleum. Bones are scattered about and arranged into strange totems, in a sign someone has been dabbling in dark magic.

PAD_DisarmedPressurePlate.synopsis: Player steps with a pressure plate that should trigger the trap in the mausoleum but nothing happens.
PAD_DisarmedPressurePlate.how_to_trigger: Step on any pressure plate near -275; -31; -844 (SCL_Main_A)

PAD_FoundDisc_2Players.synopsis: Players find the disc at the mausoleum that leads to the Shar temple.
PAD_FoundDisc_2Players.how_to_trigger: goto -280; -29; -845 and teleport with the entire party behind the wall where the secret doors are or solve the puzzle.

PAD_KethericsWifePlaque.synopsis: Reaction from player/narrator who interacts with the tomb of Isobel's mother (and Ketheric's wife).
PAD_KethericsWifePlaque.how_to_trigger: Interact with the mother's tomb in the Thorm mausoleum.

PAD_Mural_001.synopsis: Player interacts with the second mural of the Mausoleum puzzle and get the second piece of the story. This mural depicts Ketheric Thorm mourning at the tomb of his daughter (Isobel, though this is not revealed by the mural). The player's comment varies, depending on if they've met Ketheric or not.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: After reviewing the session data, a few ordering and exclusivity relationships become apparent. First, there is a clear narrative progression among the mural-related sessions. The first mural (PAD_Mural_000) reveals the opening piece of the story, the second mural (PAD_Mural_001) continues with further details (including Ketheric’s mourning), and the third mural (PAD_Mural_002) provides the final piece of that narrative sequence. Thus, they should occur in the sequence: PAD_Mural_000 → PAD_Mural_001 → PAD_Mural_002. Next, the temple-related sessions suggest that Shadowheart’s suspicions (PAD_TempleSuspicion) are expressed before the cinematic event (CINE_DescendingIntoTemple) in which the party descends into the temple. Finally, there are multiple session variants triggered at the same location (using coordinates –280; -29; -845). These are PAD_FoundDisc, PAD_FoundDisc_2Players, and PAD_OpenTomb. Since they are all triggered by the same action but represent alternative outcomes (depending on party composition or other conditions), they are mutually exclusive – only one of these can occur in a given playthrough. Other sessions (such as those that involve plaques or miscellaneous events) do not have clear ordering or exclusive relationships based on the provided data.

PAD_MyrkulSymbol_0.speaker: Player
PAD_MyrkulSymbol_0.text: What is that symbol supposed to mean?

PAD_MyrkulSymbol_2.speaker: Player
PAD_MyrkulSymbol_2.text: Myrkul's holy symbol. He must have had a follower come to this place.
PAD_MyrkulSymbol_2.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only for a myrkul-worshipper - auto-passing the religion check to recognise their god's symbol.NodeContext: Pronouned MER-kul

PAD_MakeshiftVessel_0.speaker: Player
PAD_MakeshiftVessel_0.text: What is that? Almost looks like someone was trying to grow a person.

PAD_Mural_002_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Mural_002_0.text: Ketheric Thorm, leading Shar's forces. Quite the about-face for a warrior of Selûne.

PAD_Mural_002_1.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Mural_002_1.text: *Ketheric? Helming a Sharran army? He's hiding his own past, just as he's keeping pieces of yours.*

PAD_Mural_002_2.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Mural_002_2.text: *An army of Sharrans. You've led grander hoards of truer butchers. This is nothing.*

PAD_Mural_002_3.speaker: Player
PAD_Mural_002_3.text: Whoever that elf is, he's got an army of Shar worshippers at his command.

PAD_KethericsMap_0.speaker: Player
PAD_KethericsMap_0.text: Looks like there's a temple under this place - and something deadly sealed inside it.

PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque_0.text: So Ketheric had a daughter. Wonder what became of her?

PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque_2.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque_2.text: Isobel. That's the name of the cleric at Last Light Inn, right?

PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque_1.text: Can she possibly be Ketheric's daughter?

PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque_3.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundIsobelsPlaque_3.text: Isobel's sarcophagus. Before Ketheric brought her back.

PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro_0.text: Balthazar, a necromancer lap dog of Ketheric Thorm's.

PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro_2.speaker: Player
PAD_SkullBalthazaarIntro_2.text: Who knows what he may have up his rotten sleeve.

AD_IsobelsPlaque_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_IsobelsPlaque_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks at a plaque on the side of Isobel's tomb.NodeContext: Ssussun elgg oloth (SUSS-sun ELL-gh OL-oth) - Elvish for "Light slays darkness."

PAD_TempleSuspicion_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_TempleSuspicion_0.text: There has to be more to this place. There has to be a reason I came to be here.
PAD_TempleSuspicion_0.context: NodeContext: Strong suspcion that she's somewhere important for her. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

PAD_TempleSuspicion_1.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_TempleSuspicion_1.text: Curious. Part of me thought there'd be more to this place...
PAD_TempleSuspicion_1.context: NodeContext: Starting to vocalise a sneaking suspicion that this temple is a legendary Sharran site, before dismissing the thought.

PAD_TempleSuspicion_2.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_TempleSuspicion_2.text: There's more to this place, I'm sure of it. Lady Shar's presence is near...
PAD_TempleSuspicion_2.context: NodeContext: Uncanny certainty that she's somewhere important for her. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

CINE_DescendingIntoTemple_0.context:
CinematicNodeContext: After interacting with the teleportation stone the player reacts as the large elevator disc sets into motion and starts a long desent into darkness.

NOTE: on subsequent uses of the elevator, a fade to black will be done via script.InternalNodeContext: Occurs the first time the player uses the elevator/disc linking the Thorm mausoleum in SCL to the Shar Temple.
NOTE: on subsequent uses of the elevator, a fade to black will be done via script.

PAD_FoundDisc_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundDisc_0.text: That disc looks like it can move - but where does it lead?

PAD_FoundDisc_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundDisc_1.text: This must be it. This must lead to where the Dark Justiciars came from.
PAD_FoundDisc_1.context: NodeContext: Anticipation. Arc: SH loyal to Shar.

PAD_FoundDisc_2.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundDisc_2.text: Carefully hidden. This must lead to somewhere precious to the Dark Lady.
PAD_FoundDisc_2.context: NodeContext: Anticipation. Arc: SH loyal to Shar.

PAD_Mural_000_0.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Mural_000_0.text: *Moonrise Towers. It makes the Urge hiss within. It was part of your disgrace, but how?*

PAD_Mural_000_1.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Mural_000_1.text: *This tower - a part of you knows it. A part of you hates it.*

PAD_Mural_000_2.speaker: Player
PAD_Mural_000_2.text: That bright tower... it's Moonrise. Or it used to be.

PAD_Mural_000_3.speaker: Player
PAD_Mural_000_3.text: Moonrise Towers... before Ketheric Thorm offered it over to the shadows.

PAD_Mural_000_4.speaker: Player
PAD_Mural_000_4.text: What is this bright tower? Strange.

PAD_OpenTomb_0.speaker: Player
PAD_OpenTomb_0.text: An open tomb - empty. Not ominous in the slightest.

PAD_NecromancersRoom_0.speaker: Player
PAD_NecromancersRoom_0.text: Bones everywhere... Someone's been engaging in dark rituals here.
PAD_NecromancersRoom_0.context: NodeContext: Astarion; as in 'water water everywhere, but not a drop to drink' (referring to a large amount of skeletons on display in a tomb

PAD_DisarmedPressurePlate_0.speaker: Player
PAD_DisarmedPressurePlate_0.text: Nothing - it must have been disarmed.
PAD_DisarmedPressurePlate_0.context: NodeContext: Stepped on a trap, but nothing happened

PAD_FoundDisc_2Players_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundDisc_2Players_0.text: That disc looks like it can move - a way forward?

PAD_FoundDisc_2Players_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundDisc_2Players_1.text: Where will it bring us, though?

PAD_KethericsWifePlaque_0.speaker: Narrator
PAD_KethericsWifePlaque_0.text: *Here lies Melodia Thorm, beloved wife and mother. Ai armiel telere maenen hir.*
PAD_KethericsWifePlaque_0.context: NodeContext: Ah-less-ia /  Ay Army-el Teller-eh Man-en here

PAD_Mural_001_0.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Mural_001_0.text: *Ketheric lost his daughter, but the bastard knows why you lost everything.*

PAD_Mural_001_1.speaker: Player
PAD_Mural_001_1.text: Looks like that elf lost someone dear to him.

PAD_Mural_001_2.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Mural_001_2.text: *The elf from this painting... He knows you. He was a trifling stain in your bloody past. But who is he mourning?*

PAD_Mural_001_3.speaker: Player
PAD_Mural_001_3.text: Ketheric Thorm, bowed by grief for his daughter.
